729821f-a.text:
3896 (about) Victory Boulevard, east side, at
Cannon Avenue, showing Mrs. Decker's house (Beers's 1874 map), situated about 250 feet back of the road. In 1898 the house was owned by Francis Tjakrko and in 1907 by F. Tyacks. Dates refer
to maps on which the owners' names appear.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729821f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Cannon Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729822f-a.text:
3908 Victory Boulevard, east side, at Cannon Avenue, showing an old Decker house, in all propability F. C. Decker's store shown on James Butler's 1853 map. The white house seen in the backgrodnd is another old Decker house. Butler's and Beers's maps of 1853 and 1874 respectively, show numerous
Decker houses in this localityMay 1:, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729822f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Cannon Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729823f-a.text:
3910 (about) Victory Boulevard, east side, adjoining to the south Cannon Avenue, showlmg the old C. Decker house (Butler's 1853 map), situated about 300 feet back of the road, along the narrow driveway. The maps from 1874 to 1917 show the dwelling to have belonged to A. Decker. Butler's and Beers's maps of 1853 and 1874 respectively show numerous Decker houses in this locality.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729823f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Cannon Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729824f-a.text:
3922 Victory Boulevard, east side, between Cannon Avenue and Leroy Street. The house was on the property of Scoeles (also, Scholes) in 1898 and 1907. The land on which the house is located belonged to W. P. Decker in 1874, but the house does not appear on Beers's map of that year.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729824f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Cannon Avenue, Staten Island, NY
